intro: Omphalodes micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered omphalodes, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically features opposite leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Its small, clustered flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
